2741    F66: Failure of Success Criterion 3.2.3 due to presenting navigation 2741    F66: Failure of Success Criterion 3.2.3 due to presenting navigation

2806    *Consistent Identification*: 2806    *Consistent Identification*:
2807    Understanding SC 3.2.4 2807    Understanding SC 3.2.4
2808  2808 
2809    *3.2.4 2809    *3.2.4
2810    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#consistent-behavior-consistent-functionality> 2810    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#consistent-behavior-consistent-functionality>
2811    Consistent Identification:* Components that have the same 2811    Consistent Identification:* Components that have the same
2812    functionality 2812    functionality
2813    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#samefunctionalitydef> within 2813    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#samefunctionalitydef> within
2814    a set of Web pages 2814    a set of Web pages
2815    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#webpagedef> are 2815    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#webpagedef> are
2816    identified consistently. (Level AA) 2816    identified consistently. (Level AA)
2817  2817 
2818  2818 
2819      Intent of this Success Criterion 2819      Intent of this Success Criterion
2820  2820 
2821The intent of this Success Criterion is to ensure consistent 2821The intent of this Success Criterion is to ensure consistent
2822identification of functional components that appear repeatedly within a 2822identification of functional components that appear repeatedly within a
2823set of Web pages. A strategy that people who use screen readers use when 2823set of Web pages. A strategy that people who use screen readers use when
2824operating a Web site is to rely heavily on their familiarity with 2824operating a Web site is to rely heavily on their familiarity with
2825functions that may appear on different Web pages. If identical functions 2825functions that may appear on different Web pages. If identical functions
2826have different labels on different Web pages, the site will be 2826have different labels on different Web pages, the site will be
2827considerably more difficult to use. It may also be confusing and 2827considerably more difficult to use. It may also be confusing and
2828increase the cognitive load for people with cognitive limitations. 2828increase the cognitive load for people with cognitive limitations.
2829Therefore, consistent labeling will help. 2829Therefore, consistent labeling will help.
2830  2830 
2831This consistency extends to the text alternatives. If icons or other 2831This consistency extends to the text alternatives. If icons or other
2832non-text items have the same functionality, then their text alternatives 2832non-text items have the same functionality, then their text alternatives
2833should be consistent as well. 2833should be consistent as well.
2834  2834 
2835  2835 
2836        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 3.2.4 2836        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 3.2.4
2837  2837 
2838  * 2838  *
2839  2839 
2840    People who learn functionality on one page on a site can find the 2840    People who learn functionality on one page on a site can find the
2841    desired functions on other pages if they are present. 2841    desired functions on other pages if they are present.
2842  2842 
2843  * 2843  *
2844  2844 
2845    When non-text content is used in a consistent way to identify 2845    When non-text content is used in a consistent way to identify
2846    components with the same functionality, people with difficulty 2846    components with the same functionality, people with difficulty
2847    reading text or detecting text alternatives can interact with the 2847    reading text or detecting text alternatives can interact with the
2848    Web without depending on text alternatives. 2848    Web without depending on text alternatives.
2849  2849 
2850  * 2850  *
2851  2851 
2852    People who depend on text alternatives can have a more predictable 2852    People who depend on text alternatives can have a more predictable
2853    experience. They can also search for the component if it has a 2853    experience. They can also search for the component if it has a
2854    consistent label on different pages. 2854    consistent label on different pages.
2855  2855 
2856  2856 
2857      Examples of Success Criterion 3.2.4 2857      Examples of Success Criterion 3.2.4
2858  2858 
2859  * 2859  *
2860  2860 
2861    *Example 1: Document Icon* 2861    *Example 1: Document Icon*
2862  2862 
2863    A document icon is used to indicate document download throughout a 2863    A document icon is used to indicate document download throughout a
2864    site. The text alternative for the icon always begins with the word 2864    site. The text alternative for the icon always begins with the word
2865    “Download," followed by a shortened form of the document title. 2865    “Download," followed by a shortened form of the document title.
2866    Using different text alternatives to identify document names for 2866    Using different text alternatives to identify document names for
2867    different documents is a consistent use of text alternatives. 2867    different documents is a consistent use of text alternatives.
2868  2868 
2869  * 2869  *
2870  2870 
2871    *Example 2: Check Mark* 2871    *Example 2: Check Mark*
2872  2872 
2873    A check mark icon functions as "approved", on one page but as 2873    A check mark icon functions as "approved", on one page but as
2874    "included" on another. Since they serve different functions, they 2874    "included" on another. Since they serve different functions, they
2875    have different text alternatives. 2875    have different text alternatives.
2876  2876 
2877  * 2877  *
2878  2878 
2879    *Example 3: Consistent references to other pages* 2879    *Example 3: Consistent references to other pages*
2880  2880 
2881    A Web site publishes articles on-line. Each article spans multiple 2881    A Web site publishes articles on-line. Each article spans multiple
2882    Web pages and each page contains a link to the first page, the next 2882    Web pages and each page contains a link to the first page, the next
2883    page and the previous page of the article. If the references to the 2883    page and the previous page of the article. If the references to the
2884    next page read "page 2", "page 3", "page 4" etcetera, the labels are 2884    next page read "page 2", "page 3", "page 4" etcetera, the labels are
2885    not the same but they are consistent. Therefore, these references 2885    not the same but they are consistent. Therefore, these references
2886    are not failures of this Success Criterion. 2886    are not failures of this Success Criterion.
2887  2887 
2888  * 2888  *
2889  2889 
2890    *Example 4: Icons with similar functions* 2890    *Example 4: Icons with similar functions*
2891  2891 
2892    An e-commerce application uses a printer icon that allows the user 2892    An e-commerce application uses a printer icon that allows the user
2893    to print receipts and invoices. In one part of the application, the 2893    to print receipts and invoices. In one part of the application, the
2894    printer icon is labeled "Print receipt" and is used to print 2894    printer icon is labeled "Print receipt" and is used to print
2895    receipts, while in another part it is labeled "Print invoice" and is 2895    receipts, while in another part it is labeled "Print invoice" and is
2896    used to print invoices. The labeling is consistent ("Print x"), but 2896    used to print invoices. The labeling is consistent ("Print x"), but
2897    the labels are different to reflect the different functions of the 2897    the labels are different to reflect the different functions of the
2898    icons. Therefore, this example does not fail the Success Criterion. 2898    icons. Therefore, this example does not fail the Success Criterion.
2899  2899

2905    function is provided on multiple Web pages. 2905    function is provided on multiple Web pages.

2912    another Web page both have a field to enter a term and list topics 2912    another Web page both have a field to enter a term and list topics
2913    in the Web site related to the term submitted. In this case, the 2913    in the Web site related to the term submitted. In this case, the
2914    buttons have the same functionality but are not labeled consistently. 2914    buttons have the same functionality but are not labeled consistently.

2926  2926 
2927Each numbered item in this section represents a technique or combination 2927Each numbered item in this section represents a technique or combination
2928of techniques that the WCAG Working Group deems sufficient for meeting 2928of techniques that the WCAG Working Group deems sufficient for meeting
2929this Success Criterion. The techniques listed only satisfy the Success 2929this Success Criterion. The techniques listed only satisfy the Success
2930Criterion if all of the WCAG 2.0 conformance requirements 2930Criterion if all of the WCAG 2.0 conformance requirements
2931<http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#conformance-reqs> have 2931<http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#conformance-reqs> have
2932been met. 2932been met.

2936  2936 
2937 1. 2937 1.
2938  2938 
2939    G197: Using labels, names, and text alternatives consistently for 2939    G197: Using labels, names, and text alternatives consistently for
2940    content that has the same functionality 2940    content that has the same functionality
2941    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2012/NOTE-WCAG20-TECHS-20120103/G197> *AND* 2941    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2012/NOTE-WCAG20-TECHS-20120103/G197> *AND*
2942    following the sufficient techniques for Success Criterion 1.1.1 2942    following the sufficient techniques for Success Criterion 1.1.1
2943    <https://www.w3.org/TR/2012/NOTE-UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20-20120103/text-equiv-all.html#text-equiv-all-techniques-head> 2943    <https://www.w3.org/TR/2012/NOTE-UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20-20120103/text-equiv-all.html#text-equiv-all-techniques-head>

2946    for providing labels, names, and text alternatives. 2946    for providing labels, names, and text alternatives.
2947  2947 
2948/Note 1: /Text alternatives that are "consistent" are not always 2948/Note 1: /Text alternatives that are "consistent" are not always
2949"identical." For instance, you may have an graphical arrow at the bottom 2949"identical." For instance, you may have an graphical arrow at the bottom
2950of a Web page that links to the next Web page. The text alternative may 2950of a Web page that links to the next Web page. The text alternative may
2951say "Go to page 4." Naturally, it would not be appropriate to repeat 2951say "Go to page 4." Naturally, it would not be appropriate to repeat
2952this exact text alternative on the next Web page. It would be more 2952this exact text alternative on the next Web page. It would be more
2953appropriate to say "Go to page 5". Although these text alternatives 2953appropriate to say "Go to page 5". Although these text alternatives
2954would not be identical, they would be consistent, and therefore would 2954would not be identical, they would be consistent, and therefore would
2955satisfy this Success Criterion. 2955satisfy this Success Criterion.
2956  2956 
2957/Note 2: / A single non-text-content-item may be used to serve different 2957/Note 2: / A single non-text-content-item may be used to serve different
2958functions. In such cases, different text alternatives are necessary and 2958functions. In such cases, different text alternatives are necessary and
2959should be used. Examples can be commonly found with the use of icons 2959should be used. Examples can be commonly found with the use of icons
2960such as check marks, cross marks, and traffic signs. Their functions can 2960such as check marks, cross marks, and traffic signs. Their functions can
2961be different depending on the context of the Web page. A check mark icon 2961be different depending on the context of the Web page. A check mark icon
2962may function as "approved", "completed", or "included", to name a few, 2962may function as "approved", "completed", or "included", to name a few,
2963depending on the situation. Using "check mark" as text alternative 2963depending on the situation. Using "check mark" as text alternative
2964across all Web pages does not help users understand the function of the 2964across all Web pages does not help users understand the function of the
2965icon. Different text alternatives can be used when the same non-text 2965icon. Different text alternatives can be used when the same non-text
2966content serves multiple functions. 2966content serves multiple functions.

2972techniques should be considered in order to make content more 2972techniques should be considered in order to make content more
2973accessible. Not all techniques can be used or would be effective in all 2973accessible. Not all techniques can be used or would be effective in all
2974situations. 2974situations.

3053    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#consistent-behavior-no-extreme-changes-context> 3053    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#consistent-behavior-no-extreme-changes-context>
3054    Change on Request:* Changes of context 3054    Change on Request:* Changes of context
3055    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#context-changedef> 3055    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#context-changedef>
3056    are initiated only by user request or a mechanism 3056    are initiated only by user request or a mechanism
3057    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#mechanismdef> is 3057    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#mechanismdef> is
3058    available to turn off such changes. (Level AAA) 3058    available to turn off such changes. (Level AAA)
3059  3059 
3060  3060 
3061      Intent of this Success Criterion 3061      Intent of this Success Criterion
3062  3062 
3063The intent of this Success Criterion is to encourage design of Web 3063The intent of this Success Criterion is to encourage design of Web
3064content that gives users full control of changes of context. This 3064content that gives users full control of changes of context. This
3065Success Criterion aims to eliminate potential confusion that may be 3065Success Criterion aims to eliminate potential confusion that may be
3066caused by unexpected changes of context such as automatic launching of 3066caused by unexpected changes of context such as automatic launching of
3067new windows, automatic submission of forms after selecting an item from 3067new windows, automatic submission of forms after selecting an item from
3068a list, etcetera. Such unexpected changes of context may cause 3068a list, etcetera. Such unexpected changes of context may cause
3069difficulties for people with motor impairments, people with low vision, 3069difficulties for people with motor impairments, people with low vision,
3070people who are blind, and people with certain cognitive limitations. 3070people who are blind, and people with certain cognitive limitations.
3071  3071 
3072Some types of change of context are not disruptive to some users, or 3072Some types of change of context are not disruptive to some users, or
3073actively benefit some users. For example, single-switch users rely on 3073actively benefit some users. For example, single-switch users rely on
3074context changes that are animated by the system, and the preferences of 3074context changes that are animated by the system, and the preferences of
3075low-vision users may vary depending on how much of the content they can 3075low-vision users may vary depending on how much of the content they can
3076see at once and how much of the session structure they can retain in 3076see at once and how much of the session structure they can retain in
3077working memory. Some types of content, such as slide shows, require the 3077working memory. Some types of content, such as slide shows, require the
3078ability to change context in order to provide the intended user 3078ability to change context in order to provide the intended user
3079experience. Content that initiates changes of context automatically only 3079experience. Content that initiates changes of context automatically only
3080when user preferences allow can conform to this Success Criterion. 3080when user preferences allow can conform to this Success Criterion.
3081  3081 
3082/Note: /Clicking on a link is an example of an action that is "initiated 3082/Note: /Clicking on a link is an example of an action that is "initiated
3083only by user request." 3083only by user request."
3084  3084 
3085  3085 
3086        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 3.2.5 3086        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 3.2.5
3087  3087 
3088  * 3088  *
3089  3089 
3090    Individuals who are unable to detect changes of context or may not 3090    Individuals who are unable to detect changes of context or may not
3091    realize that the context has changed are less likely to become 3091    realize that the context has changed are less likely to become
3092    disoriented while navigating a site. For example: 3092    disoriented while navigating a site. For example:
3093  3093 
3094      o 3094      o
3095  3095 
3096        individuals who are blind or have low vision may have difficulty 3096        individuals who are blind or have low vision may have difficulty
3097        knowing when a visual context change has occurred, such as a new 3097        knowing when a visual context change has occurred, such as a new
3098        window popping up. In this case, warning users of context 3098        window popping up. In this case, warning users of context
3099        changes in advance minimizes confusion when the user discovers 3099        changes in advance minimizes confusion when the user discovers
3100        that the back button no longer behaves as expected. 3100        that the back button no longer behaves as expected.
3101  3101 
3102  * 3102  *
3103  3103 
3104    Some individuals with low vision, with reading and intellectual 3104    Some individuals with low vision, with reading and intellectual
3105    disabilities, and who have difficulty interpreting visual cues may 3105    disabilities, and who have difficulty interpreting visual cues may
3106    benefit from additional cues in order to detect changes of context. 3106    benefit from additional cues in order to detect changes of context.
3107  3107 
3108  * 3108  *
3109  3109 
3110    People with certain *cognitive limitations* do not get confused if 3110    People with certain *cognitive limitations* do not get confused if
3111    automatic redirects are performed by the Web server instead of the 3111    automatic redirects are performed by the Web server instead of the
3112    browser. 3112    browser.

3115      Examples of Success Criterion 3.2.5 3115      Examples of Success Criterion 3.2.5
3116  3116 
3117  * 3117  *
3118  3118 
3119    *an "update now" button* 3119    *an "update now" button*
3120  3120 
3121    Instead of automatically updating the content, the author provides 3121    Instead of automatically updating the content, the author provides
3122    an "Update now" button that requests a refresh of the content. 3122    an "Update now" button that requests a refresh of the content.
3123  3123 
3124  * 3124  *
3125  3125 
3126    *An automatic redirection* 3126    *An automatic redirection*
3127  3127 
3128    A user is automatically redirected from an old page to a new page in 3128    A user is automatically redirected from an old page to a new page in
3129    such a way that he or she never realizes the redirect has occurred. 3129    such a way that he or she never realizes the redirect has occurred.

3320    /Note: /A change of content is not always a change of context. 3320    /Note: /A change of content is not always a change of context.
3321    Changes in content, such as an expanding outline, dynamic menu, or a 3321    Changes in content, such as an expanding outline, dynamic menu, or a
3322    tab control do not necessarily change the context, unless they also 3322    tab control do not necessarily change the context, unless they also
3323    change one of the above (e.g., focus). 3323    change one of the above (e.g., focus).

3348  3348 
3349    *Input Assistance*: 3349    *Input Assistance*:
3350    Understanding Guideline 3.3 3350    Understanding Guideline 3.3
3351  3351 
3352    *Guideline 3.3: * Help users avoid and correct mistakes. 3352    *Guideline 3.3: * Help users avoid and correct mistakes.
3353  3353 
3354  3354 
3355      Intent of Guideline 3.3 3355      Intent of Guideline 3.3
3356  3356 
3357Everyone makes mistakes. However, people with some disabilities have 3357Everyone makes mistakes. However, people with some disabilities have
3358more difficulty creating error-free input. In addition, it may be harder 3358more difficulty creating error-free input. In addition, it may be harder
3359for them to detect that they have made an error. Typical error 3359for them to detect that they have made an error. Typical error
3360indication methods may not be obvious to them because of a limited field 3360indication methods may not be obvious to them because of a limited field
3361of view, limited color perception, or use of assistive technology. This 3361of view, limited color perception, or use of assistive technology. This
3362guideline seeks to reduce the number of serious or irreversible errors 3362guideline seeks to reduce the number of serious or irreversible errors
3363that are made, increase the likelihood that all errors will be noticed 3363that are made, increase the likelihood that all errors will be noticed
3364by the user, and help users understand what they should do to correct an 3364by the user, and help users understand what they should do to correct an
3365error. 3365error.
3366  3366 
3367  3367 
3368      Advisory Techniques for Guideline 3.3 (not success criteria specific) 3368      Advisory Techniques for Guideline 3.3 (not success criteria specific)
3369  3369 
3370Specific techniques for meeting each Success Criterion for this 3370Specific techniques for meeting each Success Criterion for this
3371guideline are listed in the understanding sections for each Success 3371guideline are listed in the understanding sections for each Success
3372Criterion (listed below). If there are techniques, however, for 3372Criterion (listed below). If there are techniques, however, for
3373addressing this guideline that do not fall under any of the success 3373addressing this guideline that do not fall under any of the success
3374criteria, they are listed here. These techniques are not required or 3374criteria, they are listed here. These techniques are not required or
3375sufficient for meeting any success criteria, but can make certain types 3375sufficient for meeting any success criteria, but can make certain types
3376of Web content more accessible to more people. 3376of Web content more accessible to more people.
3377  3377

3379  3379

3383    *Error Identification*: 3383    *Error Identification*:
3384    Understanding SC 3.3.1 3384    Understanding SC 3.3.1
3385  3385 
3386    *3.3.1 3386    *3.3.1
3387    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#minimize-error-identified> 3387    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#minimize-error-identified>
3388    Error Identification:* If an input error 3388    Error Identification:* If an input error
3389    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#input-errordef> is 3389    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#input-errordef> is
3390    automatically detected, the item that is in error is identified and 3390    automatically detected, the item that is in error is identified and
3391    the error is described to the user in text. (Level A) 3391    the error is described to the user in text. (Level A)
3392  3392 
3393  3393 
3394      Intent of this Success Criterion 3394      Intent of this Success Criterion
3395  3395 
3396The intent of this Success Criterion is to ensure that users are aware 3396The intent of this Success Criterion is to ensure that users are aware
3397that an error has occurred and can determine what is wrong. The error 3397that an error has occurred and can determine what is wrong. The error
3398message should be as specific as possible. In the case of an 3398message should be as specific as possible. In the case of an
3399unsuccessful form submission, re-displaying the form and indicating the 3399unsuccessful form submission, re-displaying the form and indicating the
3400fields in error is insufficient for some users to perceive that an error 3400fields in error is insufficient for some users to perceive that an error
3401has occurred. Screen reader users, for example, will not know there was 3401has occurred. Screen reader users, for example, will not know there was
3402an error until they encounter one of the indicators. They may abandon 3402an error until they encounter one of the indicators. They may abandon
3403the form altogether before encountering the error indicator, thinking 3403the form altogether before encountering the error indicator, thinking
3404that the page simply is not functional. 3404that the page simply is not functional.
3405  3405 
3406The identification and description of an error can be combined with 3406The identification and description of an error can be combined with
3407programmatic information that user agents or assistive technologies can 3407programmatic information that user agents or assistive technologies can
3408use to identify an error and provide error information to the user. For 3408use to identify an error and provide error information to the user. For
3409example, certain technologies can specify that the user's input must not 3409example, certain technologies can specify that the user's input must not
3410fall outside a specific range, or that a form field is required. 3410fall outside a specific range, or that a form field is required.
3411Currently, few technologies support this kind of programmatic 3411Currently, few technologies support this kind of programmatic
3412information, but the Success Criterion does not require, nor prevent it. 3412information, but the Success Criterion does not require, nor prevent it.
3413  3413 
3414It is perfectly acceptable to indicate the error in other ways such as 3414It is perfectly acceptable to indicate the error in other ways such as
3415image, color etc, in addition to the text description. 3415image, color etc, in addition to the text description.
3416  3416 
3417See also /Understanding Success Criterion 3.3.3 Error Suggestion 3417See also /Understanding Success Criterion 3.3.3 Error Suggestion
3418<#minimize-error-suggestions>/. 3418<#minimize-error-suggestions>/.

3422  3422 
3423  * 3423  *
3424  3424 
3425    Providing information about input errors in text allows users who 3425    Providing information about input errors in text allows users who
3426    are blind or colorblind to perceive the fact that an error occurred. 3426    are blind or colorblind to perceive the fact that an error occurred.
3427  3427 
3428  * 3428  *

3430    This Success Criterion may help people with cognitive, language, and 3430    This Success Criterion may help people with cognitive, language, and
3431    learning disabilities who have difficulty understanding the meaning 3431    learning disabilities who have difficulty understanding the meaning
3432    represented by icons and other visual cues. 3432    represented by icons and other visual cues.

3435      Examples of Success Criterion 3.3.1 3435      Examples of Success Criterion 3.3.1
3436  3436 
3437  * 3437  *
3438  3438 
3439    *Identifying errors in a form submission* 3439    *Identifying errors in a form submission*
3440  3440 
3441    An airline Web site offers a special promotion on discounted 3441    An airline Web site offers a special promotion on discounted
3442    flights. The user is asked to complete a simple form that asks for 3442    flights. The user is asked to complete a simple form that asks for
3443    personal information such as name, address, phone number, seating 3443    personal information such as name, address, phone number, seating
3444    preference and e-mail address. If any of the fields of the form are 3444    preference and e-mail address. If any of the fields of the form are
3445    either not completed or completed incorrectly, an alert is displayed 3445    either not completed or completed incorrectly, an alert is displayed
3446    notifying the user which field or fields were missing or incorrect. 3446    notifying the user which field or fields were missing or incorrect.
3447  3447 
3448    /Note: /This Success Criterion does not mean that color or text 3448    /Note: /This Success Criterion does not mean that color or text
3449    styles cannot be used to indicate errors. It simply requires that 3449    styles cannot be used to indicate errors. It simply requires that
3450    errors also be identified using text. In this example, two asterisks 3450    errors also be identified using text. In this example, two asterisks
3451    are used in addition to color. 3451    are used in addition to color.
3452  3452 
3453  * 3453  *
3454  3454 
3455    *Providing multiple cues* 3455    *Providing multiple cues*
3456  3456 
3457    The user fails to fill in two fields on the form. In addition to 3457    The user fails to fill in two fields on the form. In addition to
3458    describing the error and providing a unique character to make it 3458    describing the error and providing a unique character to make it
3459    easy to search for the fields, the fields are highlighted in yellow 3459    easy to search for the fields, the fields are highlighted in yellow
3460    to make it easier to visually search for them as well. 3460    to make it easier to visually search for them as well.

3641  3641

3643    *Labels or Instructions*: 3643    *Labels or Instructions*:
3644    Understanding SC 3.3.2 3644    Understanding SC 3.3.2
3645  3645 
3646    *3.3.2 3646    *3.3.2
3647    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#minimize-error-cues> 3647    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#minimize-error-cues>
3648    Labels or Instructions:* Labels 3648    Labels or Instructions:* Labels
3649    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#labeldef> or 3649    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#labeldef> or
3650    instructions are provided when content requires user input. (Level A) 3650    instructions are provided when content requires user input. (Level A)
3651  3651 
3652  3652 
3653      Intent of this Success Criterion 3653      Intent of this Success Criterion
3654  3654 
3655The intent of this Success Criterion is to help users avoid making 3655The intent of this Success Criterion is to help users avoid making
3656mistakes when their input is required. To help avoid mistakes it is good 3656mistakes when their input is required. To help avoid mistakes it is good
3657user interface design to provide simple instructions and cues for 3657user interface design to provide simple instructions and cues for
3658entering information. Some users with disabilities may be more likely to 3658entering information. Some users with disabilities may be more likely to
3659make mistakes than users without disabilities or recovery from mistakes 3659make mistakes than users without disabilities or recovery from mistakes
3660may be more difficult, making mistake avoidance an important strategy 3660may be more difficult, making mistake avoidance an important strategy
3661for users with disabilities. People with disabilities rely on well 3661for users with disabilities. People with disabilities rely on well
3662documented forms and procedures to interact with a page. Blind users 3662documented forms and procedures to interact with a page. Blind users
3663need to know exactly what information should be entered into form fields 3663need to know exactly what information should be entered into form fields
3664and what the available choices are. Simple instructions visually 3664and what the available choices are. Simple instructions visually
3665connected to form controls can assist users with cognitive disabilities 3665connected to form controls can assist users with cognitive disabilities
3666or those accessing a page using a screen magnifier. 3666or those accessing a page using a screen magnifier.
3667  3667 
3668The intent of this Success Criterion is not to clutter the page with 3668The intent of this Success Criterion is not to clutter the page with
3669unnecessary information but to provide important cues and instructions 3669unnecessary information but to provide important cues and instructions
3670that will benefit people with disabilities. Too much information or 3670that will benefit people with disabilities. Too much information or
3671instruction can be just as much of a hindrance as too little. The goal 3671instruction can be just as much of a hindrance as too little. The goal
3672is to make certain that enough information is provided for the user to 3672is to make certain that enough information is provided for the user to
3673accomplish the task without undue confusion or navigation. 3673accomplish the task without undue confusion or navigation.
3674  3674 
3675  3675 
3676        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 3.3.2 3676        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 3.3.2
3677  3677 
3678  * 3678  *
3679  3679 
3680    Label elements associated with input elements insure that 3680    Label elements associated with input elements insure that
3681    information about the input field is spoken by screen readers when 3681    information about the input field is spoken by screen readers when
3682    the field receives focus. 3682    the field receives focus.
3683  3683 
3684  * 3684  *
3685  3685 
3686    Field labels located in close proximity to the associated field 3686    Field labels located in close proximity to the associated field
3687    assist users of screen magnifiers because the field and label are 3687    assist users of screen magnifiers because the field and label are
3688    more likely to visible within the magnified area of the page. 3688    more likely to visible within the magnified area of the page.
3689  3689 
3690  * 3690  *

3693    cognitive, language and learning disabilities to enter information 3693    cognitive, language and learning disabilities to enter information
3694    correctly. 3694    correctly.
3695  3695 
3696  * 3696  *
3697  3697 
3698    Clearly identifying required fields prevents a keyboard only user 3698    Clearly identifying required fields prevents a keyboard only user
3699    from submitting an incomplete form and having to navigate the 3699    from submitting an incomplete form and having to navigate the
3700    redisplayed form to find the uncompleted field and provide the 3700    redisplayed form to find the uncompleted field and provide the
3701    missing information. 3701    missing information.

3704      Examples of Success Criterion 3.3.2 3704      Examples of Success Criterion 3.3.2
3705  3705 
3706  * 3706  *
3707  3707 
3708    A field which requires the user to enter the two character 3708    A field which requires the user to enter the two character
3709    abbreviation for a US state has a link next to it which will popup 3709    abbreviation for a US state has a link next to it which will popup
3710    an alphabetized list of state names and the correct abbreviation. 3710    an alphabetized list of state names and the correct abbreviation.
3711  3711 
3712  * 3712  *
3713  3713 
3714    A field for entering a date contains initial text which indicates 3714    A field for entering a date contains initial text which indicates
3715    the correct format for the date. 3715    the correct format for the date.
3716  3716 
3717  * 3717  *
3718  3718 
3719    A field for entering a given name is clearly labeled with "Given 3719    A field for entering a given name is clearly labeled with "Given
3720    Name" and the field for family name is labeled "Family Name" to 3720    Name" and the field for family name is labeled "Family Name" to
3721    avoid confusion over which name is requested. 3721    avoid confusion over which name is requested.
3722  3722 
3723  * 3723  *
3724  3724 
3725    A U.S. phone number separates the area code, exchange, and number 3725    A U.S. phone number separates the area code, exchange, and number
3726    into three fields. Parentheses surround the area code field, and a 3726    into three fields. Parentheses surround the area code field, and a
3727    dash separates the exchange and number fields. While the punctuation 3727    dash separates the exchange and number fields. While the punctuation
3728    provides visual clues to those familiar with the U.S. telephone 3728    provides visual clues to those familiar with the U.S. telephone
3729    number format, the punctuation is not sufficient to label the 3729    number format, the punctuation is not sufficient to label the
3730    fields. The single "Phone number" label also cannot label all three 3730    fields. The single "Phone number" label also cannot label all three
3731    fields. To address this, the three fields are grouped in a 3731    fields. To address this, the three fields are grouped in a
3732    |fieldset| with the |legend| "Phone number". Visual labels for the 3732    |fieldset| with the |legend| "Phone number". Visual labels for the
3733    fields (beyond the punctuation) cannot be provided in the design, so 3733    fields (beyond the punctuation) cannot be provided in the design, so
3734    invisible labels are provided with the "title" attribute to each of 3734    invisible labels are provided with the "title" attribute to each of
3735    the three fields. The value of this attribute for the three fields 3735    the three fields. The value of this attribute for the three fields
3736    are, respectively, "Area Code", "Exchange", and "Number". 3736    are, respectively, "Area Code", "Exchange", and "Number".
3737  3737 
3738  3738

3945    Error Suggestion:* If an input error 3945    Error Suggestion:* If an input error
3946    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#input-errordef> is 3946    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#input-errordef> is
3947    automatically detected and suggestions for correction are known, 3947    automatically detected and suggestions for correction are known,
3948    then the suggestions are provided to the user, unless it would 3948    then the suggestions are provided to the user, unless it would
3949    jeopardize the security or purpose of the content. (Level AA) 3949    jeopardize the security or purpose of the content. (Level AA)
3950  3950 
3951  3951 
3952      Intent of this Success Criterion 3952      Intent of this Success Criterion
3953  3953 
3954The intent of this Success Criterion is to ensure that users receive 3954The intent of this Success Criterion is to ensure that users receive
3955appropriate suggestions for correction of an input error if it is possible. 3955appropriate suggestions for correction of an input error if it is possible.
3956  3956 
3957Success Criterion 3.3.1 provides for notification of errors. However, 3957Success Criterion 3.3.1 provides for notification of errors. However,
3958persons with cognitive limitations may find it difficult to understand 3958persons with cognitive limitations may find it difficult to understand
3959how to correct the errors. People with visual disabilities may not be 3959how to correct the errors. People with visual disabilities may not be
3960able to figure out exactly how to correct the error. In the case of an 3960able to figure out exactly how to correct the error. In the case of an
3961unsuccessful form submission, users may abandon the form because they 3961unsuccessful form submission, users may abandon the form because they
3962may be unsure of how to correct the error even though they are aware 3962may be unsure of how to correct the error even though they are aware
3963that it has occurred. 3963that it has occurred.
3964  3964 
3965The content author may provide the description of the error, or the user 3965The content author may provide the description of the error, or the user
3966agent may provide the description of the error based on 3966agent may provide the description of the error based on
3967technology-specific, programmatically determined information. 3967technology-specific, programmatically determined information.
3968  3968 
3969  3969 
3970        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 3.3.3 3970        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 3.3.3
3971  3971 
3972  * 3972  *
3973  3973 
3974    Providing information about how to correct input errors allows users 3974    Providing information about how to correct input errors allows users
3975    who have learning disabilities to fill in a form successfully. Users 3975    who have learning disabilities to fill in a form successfully. Users
3976    who are blind or have impaired vision understand more easily the 3976    who are blind or have impaired vision understand more easily the
3977    nature of the input error and how to correct it. People with motion 3977    nature of the input error and how to correct it. People with motion
3978    impairment can reduce the number of times they need to change an 3978    impairment can reduce the number of times they need to change an
3979    input value. 3979    input value.
3980  3980

3982      Examples of Success Criterion 3.3.3 3982      Examples of Success Criterion 3.3.3
3983  3983 
3984  * 3984  *
3985  3985 
3986    *Additional Help for Correcting An Input Error* 3986    *Additional Help for Correcting An Input Error*
3987  3987 
3988    The result of a form that was not successfully submitted describes 3988    The result of a form that was not successfully submitted describes
3989    an input error in place in the page along with the correct input and 3989    an input error in place in the page along with the correct input and
3990    offers additional help for the form field that caused the input error. 3990    offers additional help for the form field that caused the input error.
3991  3991 
3992  * 3992  *
3993  3993 
3994    *Suggestions from a Limited Set of Values* 3994    *Suggestions from a Limited Set of Values*
3995  3995 
3996    An input field requires that a month name be entered. If the user 3996    An input field requires that a month name be entered. If the user
3997    enters "12," suggestions for correction may include 3997    enters "12," suggestions for correction may include
3998  3998 
3999      o 3999      o
4000  4000 
4001        A list of the acceptable values, e.g., "Choose one of: January, 4001        A list of the acceptable values, e.g., "Choose one of: January,
4002        February, March, April, May, June, July, August, September, 4002        February, March, April, May, June, July, August, September,
4003        October, November, December." 4003        October, November, December."
4004  4004 
4005      o 4005      o
4006  4006

4008        name of the month." 4008        name of the month."
4009  4009

4013        month format, e.g., "Do you mean 'December'?" 4013        month format, e.g., "Do you mean 'December'?"

4026of techniques that the WCAG Working Group deems sufficient for meeting 4026of techniques that the WCAG Working Group deems sufficient for meeting
4027this Success Criterion. The techniques listed only satisfy the Success 4027this Success Criterion. The techniques listed only satisfy the Success

4032/Note: / In some cases, more than one of these situations may apply. For 4032/Note: / In some cases, more than one of these situations may apply. For
4033example, when a mandatory field also requires the data to be in a 4033example, when a mandatory field also requires the data to be in a
4034specific format. 4034specific format.

4036  4036 
4037        Sufficient Techniques 4037        Sufficient Techniques
4038  4038 
4039*Instructions:* Select the situation below that matches your content. 4039*Instructions:* Select the situation below that matches your content.
4040Each situation includes numbered techniques (or combinations of 4040Each situation includes numbered techniques (or combinations of
4041techniques) that the Working Group deems to be sufficient for that 4041techniques) that the Working Group deems to be sufficient for that
4042situation. 4042situation.

4325        before finalizing the submission. 4325        before finalizing the submission.
4326  4326 
4327  4327 
4328      Intent of this Success Criterion 4328      Intent of this Success Criterion
4329  4329 
4330The intent of this Success Criterion is to help users with disabilities 4330The intent of this Success Criterion is to help users with disabilities
4331avoid serious consequences as the result of a mistake when performing an 4331avoid serious consequences as the result of a mistake when performing an
4332action that cannot be reversed. For example, purchasing non-refundable 4332action that cannot be reversed. For example, purchasing non-refundable
4333airline tickets or submitting an order to purchase stock in a brokerage 4333airline tickets or submitting an order to purchase stock in a brokerage
4334account are financial transactions with serious consequences. If a user 4334account are financial transactions with serious consequences. If a user
4335has made a mistake on the date of air travel, he or she could end up 4335has made a mistake on the date of air travel, he or she could end up
4336with a ticket for the wrong day that cannot be exchanged. If the user 4336with a ticket for the wrong day that cannot be exchanged. If the user
4337made a mistake on the number of stock shares to be purchased, he or she 4337made a mistake on the number of stock shares to be purchased, he or she
4338could end up purchasing more stock than intended. Both of these types of 4338could end up purchasing more stock than intended. Both of these types of
4339mistakes involve transactions that take place immediately and cannot be 4339mistakes involve transactions that take place immediately and cannot be
4340altered afterwards, and can be very costly. Likewise, it may be an 4340altered afterwards, and can be very costly. Likewise, it may be an
4341unrecoverable error if users unintentionally modify or delete data 4341unrecoverable error if users unintentionally modify or delete data
4342stored in a database that they later need to access, such as their 4342stored in a database that they later need to access, such as their
4343travel profile in a travel services Web site. Test data is included in 4343travel profile in a travel services Web site. Test data is included in
4344this provision because, in order for tests to be valid, users are not 4344this provision because, in order for tests to be valid, users are not
4345allowed to modify their answers once submitted; so users need to be able 4345allowed to modify their answers once submitted; so users need to be able
4346to ensure that their submission is correct. 4346to ensure that their submission is correct.
4347  4347 
4348Users with disabilities may be more likely to make mistakes. People with 4348Users with disabilities may be more likely to make mistakes. People with
4349reading disabilities may transpose numbers and letters, and those with 4349reading disabilities may transpose numbers and letters, and those with
4350motor disabilities may hit keys by mistake. Providing the ability to 4350motor disabilities may hit keys by mistake. Providing the ability to
4351reverse actions allows users to correct a mistake that could result in 4351reverse actions allows users to correct a mistake that could result in
4352serious consequences. Providing the ability to review and correct 4352serious consequences. Providing the ability to review and correct
4353information gives the user an opportunity to detect a mistake before 4353information gives the user an opportunity to detect a mistake before
4354taking an action that has serious consequences. 4354taking an action that has serious consequences.
4355  4355 
4356User-controllable data is data that is intended to be accessed by users. 4356User-controllable data is data that is intended to be accessed by users.
4357(e.g., name and address for the user's account.) It does not refer such 4357(e.g., name and address for the user's account.) It does not refer such
4358things as internet logs and search engine monitoring data. 4358things as internet logs and search engine monitoring data.
4359  4359 
4360  4360 
4361        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 3.3.4 4361        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 3.3.4
4362  4362 
4363  * 4363  *
4364  4364 
4365    Providing safeguards to avoid serious consequences resulting from 4365    Providing safeguards to avoid serious consequences resulting from
4366    mistakes helps users with all disabilities who may be more likely to 4366    mistakes helps users with all disabilities who may be more likely to
4367    make mistakes. 4367    make mistakes.
4368  4368 
4369  4369 
4370      Examples of Success Criterion 3.3.4 4370      Examples of Success Criterion 3.3.4
4371  4371 
4372  * 4372  *
4373  4373 
4374    /Order confirmation./ 4374    /Order confirmation./
4375  4375 
4376    A Web retailer offers on-line shopping for customers. When an order 4376    A Web retailer offers on-line shopping for customers. When an order
4377    is submitted, the order information—including items ordered, 4377    is submitted, the order information—including items ordered,
4378    quantity of each ordered item, shipping address, and payment 4378    quantity of each ordered item, shipping address, and payment
4379    method—are displayed so that the user can inspect the order for 4379    method—are displayed so that the user can inspect the order for
4380    correctness. The user can either confirm the order or make changes. 4380    correctness. The user can either confirm the order or make changes.
4381  4381 
4382  * 4382  *
4383  4383 
4384    /Stock sale:/ 4384    /Stock sale:/
4385  4385 
4386    A financial services Web site lets users buy and sell stock online. 4386    A financial services Web site lets users buy and sell stock online.
4387    When a user submits an order to buy or sell stock, the system checks 4387    When a user submits an order to buy or sell stock, the system checks
4388    to see whether or not the market is open. If it is after hours, the 4388    to see whether or not the market is open. If it is after hours, the
4389    user is alerted that the transaction will be an after-hours 4389    user is alerted that the transaction will be an after-hours
4390    transaction, is told about the risks of trading outside of regular 4390    transaction, is told about the risks of trading outside of regular
4391    market hours, and given the opportunity to cancel or confirm the order. 4391    market hours, and given the opportunity to cancel or confirm the order.

4618    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#minimize-error-context-help> 4618    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#minimize-error-context-help>

4620    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#context-sensitivehelpdef> 4620    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#context-sensitivehelpdef>
4621    is available. (Level AAA) 4621    is available. (Level AAA)
4622  4622 
4623  4623 
4624      Intent of this Success Criterion 4624      Intent of this Success Criterion
4625  4625 
4626The intent of this Success Criterion is to help users avoid making 4626The intent of this Success Criterion is to help users avoid making
4627mistakes. Some users with disabilities may be more likely to make 4627mistakes. Some users with disabilities may be more likely to make
4628mistakes than users without disabilities. Using context-sensitive help, 4628mistakes than users without disabilities. Using context-sensitive help,
4629users find out how to perform an operation without losing track of what 4629users find out how to perform an operation without losing track of what
4630they are doing. 4630they are doing.
4631  4631 
4632Context-sensitive help only needs to be provided when the label is not 4632Context-sensitive help only needs to be provided when the label is not
4633sufficient to describe all functionality. The existence of 4633sufficient to describe all functionality. The existence of
4634context-sensitive help should be obvious to the user and they should be 4634context-sensitive help should be obvious to the user and they should be
4635able to obtain it whenever they require it. 4635able to obtain it whenever they require it.
4636  4636 
4637The content author may provide the help text, or the user agent may 4637The content author may provide the help text, or the user agent may
4638provide the help text based on technology-specific, programmatically 4638provide the help text based on technology-specific, programmatically
4639determined information. 4639determined information.
4640  4640

4643  4643

4645  4645 
4646    Assistance for text input helps individuals with writing 4646    Assistance for text input helps individuals with writing
4647    disabilities and people with reading and intellectual disabilities 4647    disabilities and people with reading and intellectual disabilities
4648    who often have difficulty writing text in forms or other places that 4648    who often have difficulty writing text in forms or other places that
4649    need text input. 4649    need text input.
4650  4650 
4651  * 4651  *
4652  4652 
4653    Additionally, these kinds of assistance help people who are aging 4653    Additionally, these kinds of assistance help people who are aging
4654    and have the same difficulty in text input and/or mouse operation. 4654    and have the same difficulty in text input and/or mouse operation.

4796  4796 
4797  4797 
4798      Intent of this Success Criterion 4798      Intent of this Success Criterion
4799  4799 
4800The intent of this Success Criterion is to help users with disabilities 4800The intent of this Success Criterion is to help users with disabilities
4801avoid consequences that may result from making a mistake when submitting 4801avoid consequences that may result from making a mistake when submitting
4802form data. This criterion builds on Success Criterion 3.3.4 4802form data. This criterion builds on Success Criterion 3.3.4
4803<http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#minimize-error-reversible> 4803<http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#minimize-error-reversible>
4804in that it applies to all forms that require users to submit information. 4804in that it applies to all forms that require users to submit information.
4805  4805 
4806Users with disabilities may be more likely to make mistakes and may have 4806Users with disabilities may be more likely to make mistakes and may have
4807more difficulty detecting or recovering from mistakes. People with 4807more difficulty detecting or recovering from mistakes. People with
4808reading disabilities may transpose numbers and letters, and those with 4808reading disabilities may transpose numbers and letters, and those with
4809motor disabilities may hit keys by mistake. Providing the ability to 4809motor disabilities may hit keys by mistake. Providing the ability to
4810reverse actions allows users to correct a mistake. Providing the ability 4810reverse actions allows users to correct a mistake. Providing the ability
4811to review and correct information gives the user an opportunity to 4811to review and correct information gives the user an opportunity to
4812detect a mistake before taking an action. 4812detect a mistake before taking an action.
4813  4813 
4814  4814 
4815        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 3.3.6 4815        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 3.3.6
4816  4816 
4817  * 4817  *
4818  4818 
4819    Providing safeguards to avoid consequences resulting from mistakes 4819    Providing safeguards to avoid consequences resulting from mistakes
4820    helps users with all disabilities who may be more likely to make 4820    helps users with all disabilities who may be more likely to make
4821    mistakes. 4821    mistakes.

4841this Success Criterion. The techniques listed only satisfy the Success 4841this Success Criterion. The techniques listed only satisfy the Success

4844been met. 4844been met.
